Content.Name: Schedule
Content.Title: Schedule - Education Week 2014
Content.Abstract: View the schedule of all the topics and events for Education Week.
Content.BodyCopy:
[x50728][x51144]

SCHEDULE

Following is the outline of what to expect for Education Week 2014. We hope this will be helpful as you plan your time during the conference. Information is subject to change, so please check back.

  • AT A GLANCE
  • CLASSES
  • TEACHERS
  • ACTIVITIES
  • YOUTH SCHEDULE
  • PRINTABLE

At a Glance

Below is a quick overview of the conference events for each day. Please check the tabs above for details on classes, teachers, etc.

  • Thursday
  • Friday
  • Saturday

Thursday

TimeEvent
9 a.m. Opening Ceremony
10:20 a.m. Classes
11:40 a.m. Classes
1 p.m. Classes
2:20 p.m. Devotional
3:40 p.m. Classes
5 p.m. Classes
6:20 p.m. Classes
7:00 p.m. Family/Youth Dance
8:00 p.m. Youth Dance

Friday

TimeEvent
9 a.m. Classes
10:20 a.m. Classes
11:40 a.m. Classes
1 p.m. Classes
2:20 p.m. Devotional
3:40 p.m. Classes
5 p.m. Classes
6:20 p.m. Classes
7:30 p.m. Center Stage Concert

Saturday

TimeEvent
9 a.m. Classes
10:20 a.m. Classes
11:40 a.m. Classes
1 p.m. Classes
2:20 p.m. Closing Ceremony

Printable Schedule

Option to print the schedule is below or download PDF

Classes

Select a day below for a complete list of class options,
including teachers, topics, and location.

  • Thursday
  • Friday
  • Saturday

Thursday

TimeTeacherSpecific TopicBuilding/Room
9:00 AM Opening Ceremony
Sister Mary Ellen Smoot
Former General Relief Society President.		 TAYLOR CHAPEL
10:20 AM Anderson, Joseph
Physical Preparation for a Mission
I will cover some information about physical readiness for a mission with a focus on physical fitness.		 BENSON 287
10:20 AM Bair, Ted M.
Building a Temple Marriage Into an Eternal Marriage
(Part 1)
“To Do Good and to Communicate Forget Not” (Hebrews 13:16): Principles and Skills for Better Relationships.		 ROMNEY 172
10:20 AM Baron, Ross
Old Testament Lessons About the Priesthood
The story of Aaron and Miriam in Numbers 12, connected to Numbers 11 and 16. The story illustrates key principles related to supporting those who are called by God, not seeking position, being content with what the Lord has allotted to us, and not speaking against the Lord's anointed.		 TAYLOR CHAPEL
10:20 AM Bell, Craig
The Unspeakable Gift of the Holy Ghost
Striving to Live Up to Our Spiritual Privileges D&C 121:26 - This class will explore scriptural and prophetic statements regarding the spiritual potential and blessings that are available to all covenant members who have received the Gift of the Holy Ghost.		 BENSON 219
10:20 AM Castillow, Curtis
Be a Christian Soldier Not a Weekend Warrior
The Stripling Warriors were painted to look powerful on the outside, but what’s most important is the strength they had on the inside. These spiritual warriors from the past teach Christian soldiers in the present how to overcome this world. Teens, parents, or youth leaders will especially enjoy.		 BENSON 108/110
10:20 AM Davis, Steve
How to Become a Networking All-Star
Learn how to network effectively using LinkedIn and social media from life skills coach and networking professional Steve Davis. Steve will give an in depth review and training on how to use LinkedIn to “be Found, Find Key Connections, and Foster valuable relationships.”		 MANWARING CENTER 372A
10:20 AM Packer, Phil
Let Every Man Take Heed How He Builds
The opportunity each of us has to make choices occurs everyday. We know that as we travel through life we come in contact with situations and people. Sometimes our travel is referred to as a path, sometimes as a highway, but whichever it is, we have choices to make as we experience our lives. The title of this presentation is taken from 1 Corinthians 3:10, from the words of the Apostle Paul.		 RICKS 147
10:20 AM Twitchell, Leslie
The Grandin Press and the Printing of the Book of Mormon
Come visit the Iron Acorn Press! We will consider the conditions and technology surrounding the production of the first edition Book of Mormon. See Palmyra through the eyes of those who printed the largest edition of a published book in upstate New York at the time. Use a Grandin press reproduction to print your own keepsake of an 1830 title page.		 MCKAY 249
10:20 AM Waddoups, Brad
Is This Gambling or What? Starting a Financial Journey From Burdens to Blessings
A 12-Step Program - Members of the class will discuss information and specific steps to help them make sense of their finances and have hope in the journey.		 AUSTIN 105
10:20 AM Whetten, Craig
Treasures of the Vault
Follow the history of recordkeeping and the Bible with the staff of Special Collections in the David O. McKay library. See and handle ancient artifacts—some more than 2,000 years old—that trace how humans have kept a record of their lives. This presentation will also pay special attention to the history of the Reformation period through many original Bibles and display several essential translations in their original editions—illuminated bibles written by hand, an authentic Gutenberg leaf, a first edition King James Bible, and more. Be inspired to treasure your personal and family history through a first-hand experience with history. Teens, parents, or youth leaders will especially enjoy.		 MCKAY 220
10:20 AM Youngberg, Brent
Free Will Offerings, the Exalted Pattern of Obedience
All commandments appear to have areas where we can make "Free Will Offerings". This empowers our agency. Meekness, which is submitting to Divine Will, enables us to give our full free will offerings of Love.		 MANWARING CENTER 387
11:40 AM Bair, Ted M.
Chosen People and Choice Lands: Covenant of Abraham and the Nations of Israel and the Americas
(Part 1)
Israel: A Choice Land & A Chosen People		 ROMNEY 172
11:40 AM Bell, Craig
Applying Principles of Effective Councils in Our Daily Lives
This class will focus on principles of effective councils and how they can apply in our homes, church, and community. Statements from scriptures and prophets will serve as the foundation for class discussion.		 BENSON 219
11:40 AM Bell, Susan
Give Us This Day Our Daily Rice Cake--How to Deal With Food Sensitivities
I will discuss how to deal with the initial shock of food sensitivity diagnosis, suggest practical ideas for substitute foods at camp and for the Sacrament, and provide scripture references about hope which emphasize that Heavenly Father loves us and will help us through our difficult trials.		 MANWARING CENTER 372A
11:40 AM Donne, William A.
We Will End the Conflict Now: A Discussion on Pornography, Addiction and the Sure Road to Understanding, Recovery, and Healing
You do not just treat pornography addiction; you conquer it! Join William A. Donne, author of We Will End the Conflict Now, as he discusses pornography, perspective, and the power in Christ to heal our broken hearts and end the conflict now! Teens, parents, or youth leaders will especially enjoy.		 BENSON 287
11:40 AM King, Seth
Accessing the Powers of Heaven
The Powers of Heaven are inseprably connected with the principles of righteousness. This class will creatively discuss how we as youth can most fully access the Powers of Heaven on a daily basis. Teens, parents, or youth leaders will especially enjoy.		 BENSON 108/110
11:40 AM Parry, Jennifer
Mental Health, Depression, Cognitive Therapy, and How to Change and Understand Our Thought Patterns
Thinking good thoughts, how it relates to depression; also President Uchtdorf's advice to women on how to partake of God's happiness now. Depression or happiness, can we chose?		 AUSTIN 105
11:40 PM Raish, Martin
Nephi's Zip Code and Other Perplexities: Geography and Archeology of the Book of Mormon
Because the Book of Mormon describes events that happened hundreds of years ago, it can sometimes be challenging to see the men and women of those times as real people. Where did they live? What did they looked like? What kind of clothes did they wear? What were their houses and cities like? While there are no definitive answers to questions such as these, we will explore some tantalizing possibilities that can help us bridge the gulf between their lives and ours, to make their experiences more powerful (as well as more poignant) for us today.		 SMITH 240
11:40 AM Smoot, Shane & Smoot, Mary Ellen
The Divine Power of Family: Its Purpose & Preservation
Session #1: This session will focus on the central role of the family in Heavenly Father's Plan of Happiness. We will discuss the divine design of our families and the inherit power of family relationships. We will further explore the essential and pivotal role of traditional marriage in the fulfillment of God's plan for His children. Finally, we will ponder upon the infinite mercy of the Atonement and its nurturing and healing influence in our families.		 TAYLOR CHAPEL
11:40 AM Twitchell, Leslie
The Grandin Press and the Printing of the Book of Mormon (repeat)
Come visit the Iron Acorn Press! We will consider the conditions and technology surrounding the production of the first edition Book of Mormon. See Palmyra through the eyes of those who printed the largest edition of a published book in upstate New York at the time. Use a Grandin press reproduction to print your own keepsake of an 1830 title page.		 MCKAY 249
11:40 AM Wahlquist, Robert
To Burn? or Not to Burn? What LDS Know About the 2nd Coming That the World Does Not Know
We are living in wonderfully exciting times. Each day brings us closer to the return of the LORD GOD to the earth to rule and reign for a thousand years (See Article of Faith 10). Latter-Day Saints have Living Prophets, who have been receiving revelation and talking about the 2nd coming for 186 years. During that time, they have revealed many things about the 2nd coming—that rest of the world does not know. (And as one Latter-day Apostle put it… ‘have scarcely dawned on the Latter-day Saints themselves.’) The 2nd Coming is Coming. We are commanded to know and watch the signs. (See D&C 45:39) So, come to this class to see what the modern prophets are saying about the second coming. You will learn some things that Latter-day Saints should know that bring GREAT PEACE in a time of great commotion.		 RICKS 173
11:40 AM Whetten, Craig
Treasures of the Vault (repeat)
Follow the history of recordkeeping and the Bible with the staff of Special Collections in the David O. McKay library. See and handle ancient artifacts—some more than 2,000 years old—that trace how humans have kept a record of their lives. This presentation will also pay special attention to the history of the Reformation period through many original Bibles and display several essential translations in their original editions—illuminated bibles written by hand, an authentic Gutenberg leaf, a first edition King James Bible, and more. Be inspired to treasure your personal and family history through a first-hand experience with history. Teens, parents, or youth leaders will especially enjoy.		 MCKAY 220
11:40 AM Willis, Michelle
How to Conduct Music
Become an instant asset to your ward, school, or civic group by learning how to conduct music! We will cover beat patterns, entrances and cut-offs, cues, dynamics, and more.		 MANWARING CENTER 387
1:00 PM Anderson, Joseph
Physical Preparation for a Mission (repeat)
I will cover some information about physical readiness for a mission with a focus on physical fitness.		 BENSON 287
1:00 PM Bair, Ted M.
The Second Coming of Christ: Parallels with Christ's First Coming
(Part 1)
Warnings: Changes on Earth and in the Heavens		 ROMNEY 172
1:00 PM Bell, Craig
The Unspeakable Gift of the Holy Ghost - Striving to Live Up to Our Spiritual Privileges D&C 121:26 (repeat)
This class will explore scriptural and prophetic statements regarding the spiritual potential and blessings that are available to all covenant members who have received the Gift of the Holy Ghost.		 BENSON 219
1:00 PM Bell, Susan
Give Us This Day Our Daily Rice Cake - How to Deal With Food Sensitivities (repeat)
I will discuss how to deal with the initial shock of food sensitivity diagnosis, suggest practical ideas for substitute foods at camp and for the Sacrament, and provide scripture references about hope which emphasize that Heavenly Father loves us and will help us through our difficult trials.		 MANWARING CENTER 372A
1:00 PM Dunn, C. Ryan
He Said, She Said - Finding Communion in Communication
In this class, we will discuss the importance of communication as a way to bring husbands and wives closer. We will discuss how this process also and most importantly, can bring the Lord into our lives and marriages.		 RICKS 147
1:00 PM Fernquist, Robert
Technology Can Benefit or Impair the Life of a Teenager
The focus of this class is how texting, surfing the Internet, etc. influence the lives of our children, for better and for worse.		 TAYLOR 120
1:00 PM Lyons, Timm
Singing Together - Education Week Choir
(Part 1)
Prepare a musical number for the closing ceremony		 TAYLOR 130
1:00 PM Mandin, Thad
Teaching and Learning the Gospel With Your Teens
Parents are the most influential gospel teachers in their teenager's life. Actively teaching and guiding is a two way street for both the teen and the parent, and when done carefully, both can greatly benefit.		 RICKS 161
1:00 PM Satterfield, Bruce
Our Premortal Experience
A discussion of Man's premortal existence based upon the scriptures and teachings of latter-day prophets.		 TAYLOR CHAPEL
1:00 PM Wahlquist, Robert
To Burn? or Not to Burn? What LDS Know About the 2nd Coming That the World Does Not Know (repeat)
We are living in wonderfully exciting times. Each day brings us closer to the return of the LORD GOD to the earth to rule and reign for a thousand years (See Article of Faith 10). Latter-Day Saints have Living Prophets, who have been receiving revelation and talking about the 2nd coming for 186 years. During that time, they have revealed many things about the 2nd coming—that rest of the world does not know. (And as one Latter-day Apostle put it… ‘have scarcely dawned on the Latter-day Saints themselves.’) The 2nd Coming is Coming. We are commanded to know and watch the signs. (See D&C 45:39) So, come to this class to see what the modern prophets are saying about the second coming. You will learn some things that Latter-day Saints should know that bring GREAT PEACE in a time of great commotion.		 RICKS 173
1:00 PM Youngberg, Brent & Ruth
Serving a Mission Together Can Enhance Your Marriage
Leaving home and family to go on a mission as a senior couple can be a scary undertaking, but the benefits are worth it. The growth and learning, stretching and becoming enhance your marriage. So. . . kids, we're here to help your folks go on a mission.		 MANWARING CENTER 387
2:20 PM Devotional
President Kim B. Clark
BYU-Idaho President.		 TAYLOR CHAPEL
3:40 P.M. Bair, Ted M.
The Plan: God’s Plan for Our Salvation, Happiness and Redemption
(Part 1)
“In the Beginning, God”: Premortal Preparations & Creation		 ROMNEY 172
3:40 PM Davis, Steve
How to Succeed in College 101
Steve Davis teaches the BYU-Idaho course Principles of Personal Achievement and has many years experience teaching students how to make the most of their time as college students maximizing their capacity to earn better grades — even straight A’s. Steve will review effective time management, basic study skills including power reading, test taking tips, note taking skills, and memory methods. Teens, parents, or youth leaders will especially enjoy.		 MANWARING CENTER 372A
3:40 PM Doman, Larry
A Key to the Understanding of the Novel, Don Quixote de La Mancha and the Stage Play, Man of La Mancha
As a result of this experience, class members will gain a better understanding of one of the greatest novels ever written: Don Quixote de la Mancha by Miguel de Cervantes. By so doing, they too will be able to appreciate more fully the Broadway Stage Play & Hollywood film, Opera, Ballet, etc. based on the book.		 RICKS 173
3:40 PM Donne, William A
We Will End the Conflict Now: A Discussion on Pornography, Addiction and the Sure Road to Understanding, Recovery and Healing (repeat)
You do not just treat pornography addiction; you conquer it! Join William A. Donne, author of We Will End the Conflict Now, as he discusses pornography, perspective, and the power in Christ to heal our broken hearts and end the conflict now! Teens, parents, or youth leaders will especially enjoy.		 BENSON 287
3:40 PM Dye, John
Tweeting Testimony, Blogging Beliefs, and Instagramming Inspiration: The Role of Social Media in Spreading the Gospel
With the advent of social media, missionary work has changed dramatically. With the single click of a button, we can share our beliefs with thousands of people in a matter of seconds.		 SMITH 240
3:40 PM Gibson, Kelly
Our Part of the Gift
As a group we’ll explore answers to questions using our own experiences, the words of latter-day and ancient prophets that help us better understand our part of this precious mortal probation.		 TAYLOR CHAPEL
3:40 PM Howard, Daris
That Crazy World of Dating
Males and females were made to be different to be compliment each other. But these differences sometimes bring confusion to the opposite gender, especially during the dating years. Teens, parents, or youth leaders will especially enjoy.		 BENSON 108/110
3:40 PM Mandin, Thad
Teaching and Learning the Gospel With Your Teens (repeat)
Parents are the most influential gospel teachers in their teenager's life. Actively teaching and guiding is a two way street for both the teen and the parent, and when done carefully, both can greatly benefit.		 RICKS 161
3:40 PM Packer, Phil
Let Every Man Take Heed How He Builds (repeat)
The opportunity each of us has to make choices occurs everyday. We know that as we travel through life we come in contact with situations and people. Sometimes our travel is referred to as a path, sometimes as a highway, but whichever it is, we have choices to make as we experience our lives. The title of this presentation is taken from 1 Corinthians 3:10, from the words of the Apostle Paul.		 RICKS 147
3:40 PM Thueson, Clair & Ann
The Power of the Temple in Our Lives
Elder Body K. Packer said: “Ordinances and covenants become our credentials for admission to his presence. To worthily receive them is the quest of a lifetime; to keep them thereafter is the challenge of mortality.” These ordinances can only be received in the temples of the Lord. Our lives are enriched as we receive these ordinances and continue to do the work for those who have gone before us. In the Wagon Box prophecy given in 1884 by Wilford Woodruff, he said that: “God will bless and multiply the land.” We see the results or that prophecy in our beautiful Snake River Valley today.		 TAYLOR 120
3:40 PM Youngberg, Brent
Free Will Offerings, the Exalted Pattern of Obedience (repeat)
All commandments appear to have areas where we can make "Free Will Offerings". This empowers our agency. Meekness, which is submitting to Divine Will, enables us to give our full free will offerings of Love.		 MANWARING CENTER 387
5:00 PM Bair, Ted M.
The Church of Jesus Christ and Other Christians
(Part 1)
“Who is the Lord…” (Exodus 5:2): The Nature of God		 ROMNEY 172
5:00 PM
CLASS CANCELED		 Doman, Larry
A Key to the Understanding of the Novel, Don Quixote de La Mancha and the Stage Play, Man of La Mancha (repeat)
As a result of this experience, class members will gain a better understanding of one of the greatest novels ever written: Don Quixote de la Mancha by Miguel de Cervantes. By so doing they too will be able to appreciate more fully the Broadway Stage Play & Hollywood film, Opera, Ballet, etc. based on the book.		 RICKS 173
5:00 PM Dye, John
Tweeting Testimony, Blogging Beliefs, and Instagramming Inspiration: The Role of Social Media in Spreading the Gospel
With the advent of social media, missionary work has changed dramatically. With the single click of a button, we can share our beliefs with thousands of people in a matter of seconds. Teens, parents, or youth leaders will especially enjoy.		 SMITH 240
5:00 PM Fackrell, Matthew
Finding Happiness Even in a Stressful Life
We will be talking about stress, the physiology behind stress, and what it can do to our bodies. We will also talk about what can be done to help--using modern medicine and the gospel.		 MANWARING CENTER 372A
5:00 PM Fernquist, Robert
His, Hers, and Theirs: Common Problems in (and Helpful Solutions for) Step Families
The focus of this class is on examining unique situations that step-families encounter, such as being a step-parent and dealing with both an ex-spouse and a current spouse while raising biological children and step-children.		 TAYLOR 120
5:00 PM Howard, Daris
What Scholarly Research Can Tell Us About the Jaredites
Both Mormon and Moroni felt a great need to include the story of the ancient civilization of the Jaredites. Not only are there great things to learn from the book of Ether itself, but there are fascinating scientific studies, that give much insight into these people and what we can learn from them. Not only are there great things to learn from the book of Ether itself, but there are fascinating scientific studies, that give much insight into these people and what we can learn from them.		 BENSON 108/110
5:00 PM Mandin, Thad
Teaching and Learning the Gospel With Your Teens (repeat)
Parents are the most influential gospel teachers in their teenager's life. Actively teaching and guiding is a two way street for both the teen and the parent, and when done carefully, both can greatly benefit.		 RICKS 161
5:00 PM Packard, Kevin
Blessed and Sanctified . . . (Gen 2:3)
To Moses, the Lord declared: "Verily my sabbaths ye shall keep: for it is a sign between me and you throughout your generations; that ye may know that I am the Lord that doth sanctify you."		 TAYLOR CHAPEL
5:00 PM Poulter, LaNae
The Parable of the Hair
This interactive presentation discusses a curious question: “What if our testimonies were as obvious as the hairs on our head?” The impromptu discovery reveals self-righteousness, human error, denial, sorrow, repentance, and healing.		 BENSON 287
6:20 PM Donne, William A.
Giving Victory Wings: Earning, Celebrating and Protecting Our Victories in Christ
No matter the struggle, there is hope. What’s broken can be fixed, what hurts can be healed. When all seems lost, when you feel to go no further, remember this: you are never alone; for it is together that we stand on the threshold of victory!		 BENSON 287
6:20 PM Dye, John
Tweeting Testimony, Blogging Beliefs, and Instagramming Inspiration: The Role of Social Media in Spreading the Gospel
With the advent of social media, missionary work has changed dramatically. With the single click of a button, we can share our beliefs with thousands of people in a matter of seconds. Teens, parents, or youth leaders will especially enjoy.		 SMITH 240
6:20 PM Fackrell, Matthew
We Can Find Peace, Even Among Sadness, Depression, and Other Psychiatric Hardships
Depression and other psychiatric disorders can be devastating, but is also very common. We will be discussing what these disorders are, and how we can use both the gospel and modern medicine to overcome these hardships.		 MANWARING CENTER 372A
6:20 PM Howard, Daris
Book, Play, and Column Writing, Publishing and Marketing
Many people have written books, short stories, or other material, but have no idea what to do with them. This will give the participants a chance to learn some of the options that are available to get their work published in both print and digital forms. We will also talk about some strategies for marketing.		 BENSON 108/110
6:20 PM Packard, Kevin
Blessed and Sanctified . . . (Gen 2:3) (repeat)
To Moses, the Lord declared: "Verily my sabbaths ye shall keep: for it is a sign between me and you throughout your generations; that ye may know that I am the Lord that doth sanctify you."		 TAYLOR CHAPEL
6:20 PM Youngberg, Brent & Ruth
Serving a Mission Together can Enhance Your Marriage (repeat)
Leaving home and family to go on a mission as a senior couple can be a scary undertaking, but the benefits are worth it. The growth and learning, stretching and becoming enhance your marriage. So. . . kids, we're here to help your folks go on a mission.		 MANWARING CENTER 387
7:00-9:00 Smith, Doug
Fun Dances for Families
 HINCKLEY 260

Friday

TimeTeacherSpecific TopicBuilding/Room
9:00 AM Bair, Ted M.
The Plan: God’s Plan for Our Salvation, Happiness and Redemption
(Part 2)
“Is There a Better Home Than Garden?”: The Garden of Eden		 ROMNEY 172
9:00 AM Castillow, Curtis
God’s Promises: Sometimes Slow but Always Certain
God makes promises to all of us through priesthood blessings, patriarchal blessings, and through the covenants we make. Yet, some blessings he promised seem unfulfilled. But even though his promises are not always swift, they are always certain.		 BENSON 108/110
9:00 AM Cordon, Mike
Educating Zion
Come learn about BYU-Idaho’s Pathway program. What started as a humble pilot program of three sites in the United States serving roughly 50 students has emerged into a successful educational system of over 175 worldwide sites, serving thousands of students each year. As President Eyring suggested in 1971, this university must find “direct ways to move the blessing of education … from this campus out into the lives of men and women everywhere.”		 BENSON 219
9:00 AM Fernquist, Robert
Keeping the Love Alive During Middle-Age and After the Children (Initially) Leave Home
The focus of this class is on two topics related to marriage in later life: (1) Identifying ways to help couples maintain a strong love for one another as they become middle-aged and enter the ‘empty nest’ syndrome and (2) helping couples deal with potential stresses when adult children move back in with their parents (often referred to as the ‘full nest’ syndrome).		 SMITH 240
9:00 AM Francis, Laurie
Sneak Peek: Special Collections & the Grandin Press Replica
Experience the history of 19th-century Latter-day Saint recordkeeping by viewing an original first edition Book of Mormon and learning how it was printed. This presentation will also focus on texts from Latter-day Saints in the 19th and early 20th centuries, including LDS editions of scriptures, missionary journals, early hymnals, and other records. Increase your testimony of the Book of Mormon and the value of your own personal history through a hands-on experience using the only working replica of the Grandin Press. Teens, parents, or youth leaders will especially enjoy.		 MCKAY 220
9:00 AM Gibson, Kelly
Technology and the Family: Developing Worthy Lifelong Digital Habits
With technology being paved into each of our lives it is important to learn habits that enable a healthy digital lifestyle. We’ll explore practical tips and methods families and individuals can use to develop worthy lifelong digital habits.		 RICKS 173
9:00 AM Mandin, Thad
Teaching and Learning the Gospel With Your Teens (repeat)
Parents are the most influential gospel teachers in their teenager's life. Actively teaching and guiding is a two way street for both the teen and the parent, and when done carefully, both can greatly benefit.		 RICKS 161
9:00 AM Packard, Kevin
". . . six hundred threescore and six?"
In JST Revelation 13:1, the apostle John describes a beast that will rise up out of the sea. He afterwards associates this beast with the number six hundred threescore and six. Moroni declared that the revelations which John wrote will be "unfolded in the eyes of all the people." In this presentation, we will explore Old Testament connections that may help to unfold John's revelations.		 TAYLOR CHAPEL
9:00 AM Packer, Phil
Let Every Man Take Heed How He Builds (repeat)
The opportunity each of us has to make choices occurs everyday. We know that as we travel through life we come in contact with situations and people. Sometimes our travel is referred to as a path, sometimes as a highway, but whichever it is, we have choices to make as we experience our lives. The title of this presentation is taken from 1 Corinthians 3:10, from the words of the Apostle Paul.		 RICKS 147
9:00 AM Poulter, LaNae
The Parable of the Hair (repeat)
This interactive presentation discusses a curious question: “What if our testimonies were as obvious as the hairs on our head?” The impromptu discovery reveals self-righteousness, human error, denial, sorrow, repentance, and healing.		 BENSON 287
9:00 AM Spiel, Robert
The Power of the Word
A simple and life-changing approach to searching the Scriptures and experiencing the power of the word of God.		 AUSTIN 105
9:00 AM Youngberg, Brent
Free Will Offerings, the Exalted Pattern of Obedience (repeat)
All commandments appear to have areas where we can make "Free Will Offerings". This empowers our agency. Meekness, which is submitting to Divine Will, enables us to give our full free will offerings of Love.		 MANWARING CENTER 387
9:00 AM Waddoups, Brad
Is This Gambling or What? Starting a Financial Journey From Burdens to Blessings - A 12-Step Program (repeat)
Members of the class will discuss information and specific steps to help them make sense of their finances and have hope in the journey.		 MC 372
10:20 AM Anderson, Joseph
Physical Preparation for a Mission (repeat)
I will cover some information about physical readiness for a mission wit a focus on physical fitness		 BENSON 287
10:20 AM Bair, Ted M.
Building a Temple Marriage Into an Eternal Marriage
(Part 2)
“Be Swift to Hear” (James 1:19): Listen - - Do You Want to Know a Secret?		 ROMNEY 172
10:20 AM Davis, Rick
The Fall of Napoleon and the Rise of Joseph
Napoleon’s brief fifteen years of power (1799-1814) left major changes across Europe, not just France. A natural leader, he single-handedly rewrote the roles of government, church, and the common man. Those ripples came to America too. You and I are what we are in large measure due to a single man.		 TAYLOR 120
10:20 AM Davis, Steve
How to Succeed in College 101
Steve Davis teaches the BYU-Idaho course Principles of Personal Achievement and has many years experience teaching students how to make the most of their time as college students maximizing their capacity to earn better grades — even straight A’s. Steve will review effective time management, basic study skills including power reading, test taking tips, note taking skills, and memory methods. Teens, parents, or youth leaders will especially enjoy.		 MANWARING CENTER 372A
10:20 AM Baron, Ross
The Power of the Word: How Can I Enhance My Personal Scripture Study?
This class will be a review from the scriptures and the words of the prophets on how to enhance our personal scripture study. The purpose will be to motivate individuals to search and seek to understand the word of God such that they will be equipped to divide asunder all the cunning of the devil (Helaman 3:29). The focus will be on practical tips, skills, and techniques to make scripture study powerful.		 TAYLOR CHAPEL
10:20 AM Bell, Craig
Applying Principles of Effective Councils in our Daily Lives (repeat)
This class will focus on principles of effective councils and how they can apply in our homes, church, and community. Statements from scriptures and prophets will serve as the foundation for class discussion.		 BENSON 219
10:20 AM Castillow, Curtis
To “See As” We “Are Seen“—Seeing Ourselves As God Sees Us
If we could see ourselves and others as God sees us we would see people with less problems and more potential, less weakness and more strength. This talk focuses on how the Lord and his prophets teach us to see beyond what’s on the outside and see what’s on the inside, beyond what a person is now to what they will be later. 6:20 PM Raish, Martin
Nephi's Zip Code and Other Perplexities: Geography and Archeology of the Book of Mormon (repeat)

What did they looked like? What kind of clothes did they wear? What were their houses and cities like? 9:00 AM Ashton, Brian
Grit and Resilience: Key Components of Personal and Family Growth
Developing Grit and Resilience can help us find contentment, face challenging times, overcome our weaknesses, and ultimately grow. Children and adults that develop grit and resilience tend to thrive; they are consistent in their daily effort; they see mistakes as opportunities to learn and grow; their faith reflects their understanding that they can grow. These are traits that can be developed in our life and in the lives of our loved ones.		 RICKS 173

The world has decided that most things are disposable - and marriage is no different, but as eternal children of a Heavenly Father, we know better. 1:00 PM Raish, Martin
Nephi's Zip Code and Other Perplexities: Geography and Archeology of the Book of Mormon (repeat)
Because the Book of Mormon describes events that happened hundreds of years ago, it can sometimes be challenging to see the men and women of those times as real people. Where did they live? What did they look like? What kind of clothes did they wear? What were their houses and cities like? While there are no definitive answers to questions such as these, we will explore some tantalizing possibilities that can help us bridge the gulf between their lives and ours, to make their experiences more powerful (as well as more poignant) for us today.		 SMITH 240
1:00 PM Satterfield, Bruce
The Postmortal Spirit World
A discussion regarding six principles associated with the doctrine of the Postmortal spirit world as found in the scriptures and teachings of latter-day prophets.		 TAYLOR CHAPEL
1:00 PM Willis, Michelle
How Can I Hang On? Messages of Hope and Healing When You or Someone You Love Has a Mental Illness (repeat)
Mental Illness is a disease that can strike anyone and leaves emotional scars on both the afflicted and their loved ones, but there is hope in seeking to understand the process and purpose of these illnesses and how to see the great potential behind the grief.		 MANWARING CENTER 387
2:20 PM Closing Ceremonies
Elder W. Rolfe Kerr
Emeritus Member of the First Quorum of the Seventy.		 TAYLOR CHAPEL

      Activities

      To add to your experience, arrangements have been made for Education Week participants of all ages to choose from any of the following activities to do between the many classes offered. A 2014 Education Week Wrist Band is required to participate.

      ZUMBA Thu, Fri, and Sat, 7-8 a.m. Hart 234 (Modest dress standards, please.)
      MORNING BASKETBALL, Drop-In Thu, Fri, and Sat, 7-8 a.m. BYU-Idaho Center Auditorium Courts. Stop by with your team or come and be assigned. (Modest dress standards, please.)
      SWIMMING Thu, Fri, and Sat, 6 -10 a.m. Open for Free Swim (Bring your own suit. Modest dress standards, please.)
      ROLLER SKATING Thu and Fri, 6 -10 p.m. Manwaring Center West Ballroom
      BOWLING Thu and Fri, 6 -10 p.m. Manwaring Center, bottom floor
      ROPES COURSE Thu and Fri, 9 a.m.-9 p.m., and Sat., 9 a.m.-3 p.m., South of baseball diamonds on 7th South. (Classes are 2 hours and must be scheduled at the Education Week registration desk in the Manwaring Center. Waiver forms are required for all participants and parents' permission is required for participants under 18 years old.)
      FITNESS CENTER Thu, Fri, and Sat, 5 a.m. -11 p.m. Hart Building $3 fee (includes BYU-Idaho gym issue clothing)
      PLANETARIUM SHOWS Thu & Fri, 9-4 p.m. and 7-9 p.m.; Sat 9-2 p.m.

      Youth Programs

      As part of Education Week 2014, youth ages 6-18 are invited to participate in a full program of age-appropriate classes, activities, and discussions throughout the conference. Individuals will be able to check in at Education Week Headquarters (Manwaring Center 176C) for his or her track when they arrive on campus. Following is a table showing the details and a schedule for each age group.

      Join us for live, online streaming of the Opening and Closing events, President Clark's Devotional, and three selected classes.

      Sometimes parents may want to take a child to class; they are welcome to do so. However, we ask that parents be sensitive
      to those around them.

      Programs specially designed for youth ages 6–11, 12–13, and 14–18 are available. You may view the Youth Programs schedule (in PDF format) and register your children through the registration page.

      Visit the website often for updates and changes.
